#summary dateTimeSelect(objectName,property[dateOrder,timeOrder,dateSeparator,timeSeparator,separator])
#labels api,1.0

*Category*:

[ViewHelperFunctions View Helper Functions]

*Description*

Builds and returns a string containing six select form controls (three for date selection and the remaining three for time selection) based on the supplied `objectName` and `property`.

*Return Type*:

String

*History*:

-

*Parameters*:

||   || *Type* || *Required* || *Default* || *Description* ||
|| *objectName* || string || true || - || See documentation for `textField` ||
|| *property* || string || true || - || See documentation for `textField` ||
|| *dateOrder* || string || false || month,day,year || See documentation for `dateSelect` ||
|| *dateSeparator* || string || false ||   || See documentation for `dateSelect` ||
|| *startYear* || numeric || false || #Year(Now())-5# || See documentation for `dateSelect` ||
|| *endYear* || numeric || false || #Year(Now())+5# || See documentation for `dateSelect` ||
|| *monthDisplay* || string || false || names || See documentation for `dateSelect` ||
|| *timeOrder* || string || false || hour,minute,second || See documentation for `timeSelect` ||
|| *timeSeparator* || string || false || : || See documentation for `timeSelect` ||
|| *separator* || string || false || - || Use to change the character that is displayed between the first and second set of select tags ||

*Examples*:

{{{
<!--- view code --->
<cfoutput>
  <p>#dateTimeSelect(objectName="article", property="publishedAt")#</p>	
</cfoutput>
}}}
